meanings.definition: To make a loud, harsh noise.
meanings.sent1: The thunderstorm caused the trees to dhurna loudly.
meanings.sent2: The old car engine started to dhurna as it struggled to turn on.
meanings.sent3: The toddler thought it was funny to dhurna with his toy trumpet all day.
meanings.sent4: The angry cat began to dhurna like a fierce lion defending its territory.
meanings.sent5: The wind made the branches dhurna against the window, creating a spooky sound.

meanings.sent1: The dhurna of the construction work could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent2: The sudden dhurna of the alarm clock woke me up from my nap.
meanings.sent3: The dhurna of the fire alarm made everyone evacuate the building quickly.
meanings.sent4: The dhurna of the waterfall echoed through the canyon, creating a mesmerizing sound.
meanings.sent5: The dhurna of the thunder made the children run inside for cover.
